intro: Erigeron eatonii var. sonnei, commonly known as Sonne's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments.
